topic.title: Just uploaded the latest PewDiePie video to test the YouTube clone
topic.body:
Someone really needs to make a better clone and call it ZeroTube or something, that shit is horrible.
But video content is one of the main things this plataform has to concentrate in, it drives TONS of traffic.

1565166240_1CN9rdrWkKbk8EmDSQNZZrwGmd8Tv.body:
> [kaffie](#comment_867_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): ZeroMail? I'm not familiar with what riseup.net does, or what you're looking for.

Riseup is a leftist roleplaying site.

1565188740_1JpWZr3hPmL8cYSKQCzuqUyhG25Uu.body:
> [mfs](#comment_1_1B8Nj3YZQSgw2aqhrHof5w73RpP6Xk2a7W): I hope they stay. I'm thinking this might be what finally gives zeronet legs.

Devs need to make proper replacements for services like youtube/twitter/reddit if they want this to really take off with normies, right now the chan site is too feature basic, "youtube" Zite doesn't work at all, the Voat Zite is shit and i don't even know if there is a twitter replacement.

> [theosis](#comment_9_149W17bFN1NbQou6iE81Uq2b8wEvyqwUV1): Do you really think that there is a need for people who use youtube/twitter/reddit?

Yes, thats the whole point, to replace the mainstream sites that have gone full orwellian censorship, if you want ZeroNet to take off, thats what you need to do, if not, it will stay your little tree house club forever and it will never achieve its ojbective of true freedom in the web.

> [theosis](#comment_10_149W17bFN1NbQou6iE81Uq2b8wEvyqwUV1): I was completely satisfied with the Internet when it was my little tree house club in the 90s. Everything went to shit once corporations brought millions of people in who only care about menial shit like social networks and cat videos. [...]

You are not the reason ZeroNet exists, per the creator itself, ZeroNet was not made for you to feel special.

1565272923_1NFJShBdHywQbAzqKUVzAv4Qekh1B.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_897_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): "YouTube" is an old clone of KopyKate BIG Official. It's outdated and hardly reskinned.

Im new to ZeroNet and don't know much about the past, but there has to be some open source clones that are easily deployable here right?

Also, can you confirm if you are able to play the video i uploaded?

> [theosis](#comment_32_149W17bFN1NbQou6iE81Uq2b8wEvyqwUV1): Video content is the least convenient to share via ZeroNet. There are better alternatives.

How come? Video content is the most shared thing on torrent, isn't the whole point of ZeroNet to replace everything with P2P?

> [microvito](#comment_2_18Sf57EgpHUvv4aKaMTGDnAikVjLa1XSPu): Alternatives: [...]

They are all the same thing with different name, the one named youtube seems to be only one with seeders.

> [styromaniac](#comment_898_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): If we all had enough storage, then it wouldn't be a problem. 4K videos stream just fine.

Its more about quantity of users than of harddrive space IMO, the better content a possible ZeroTube had, the more users and then it would all snowball from there.

> [gerula](#comment_3_14SVpYv1GjxQvyThD1rSPFRZxbGibj9aa1): The problem I see with video sharing is that the files are too big so you run out of space pretty fast.

4k movie torrents that are 10~20gb are getting very popular now, its not about size, its about amount of users.

> [gerula](#comment_4_14SVpYv1GjxQvyThD1rSPFRZxbGibj9aa1): I get that and I agree but my point is this only works if people are willing to share TB of space on their hard drives plus the traffic that's comes with that.

Well, thats the whole point of ZeroNet isn't it? People willing to share disk space and bandwidth to enjoy a decentralized web.

> [wejetheman](#comment_1_18h7dSc5vXQNRA1sjyUmX7zaUTsFARHa5U): It's not so much a technical problem with the software. It's an economics problem. There needs to be a way to pay for reliable long term hosting of content and people need to be willing to actually pay. Youtube wouldn't work either without money flowing through it in the form of advertisers and ads.

So the solution to censorship in paid hosting services is to make a P2P internet where you have to pay for hosting services? What kind of reasoning is that? No, you don't need paid hosting to have videos, torrenting already proved that.

> [turncoat](#comment_5_1Cx3BTrQckf6v9Hm9KSAJxztGxqoTwAT4m): Just use Bitchute links.  It's also built on bittorrent, retard.

Bitchute still depends on hosting to function, retard, if bitchute.com goes away everything goes away, retard.

1565288290_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: They are going really hard on the anti-ZeroNet propaganda, lets see how long it takes for the complete deplatforming of the software.

1565292603_1H79P7Dn1eqyVFFhsPux4ZyApMuhz.body: Move the folder where you execute the exe?

1565292753_1Hc87xHmLsZyaGTQYnx2UmQPKwE1E.body: You deserve a Pulitzer for your investigative work.

> [223556](#comment_36_1LdgxNSynzpd5Vyi3Ej12adEuWbo1nWFu9): Without 8chan being shoah'd I wouldn't have found this place, matter of fact I would have no incentive to use zeronet at all. That goes for alot of new users.I know I'll stay here even if 8chan comes back up, this place, the people in it and the platform in general. is great.

Same here, i had read about it but never found the need to use it.
Its a shame 08chan is so basic in features, i guess in the future if its updated there won't be a need for a hosted chan anymore.
Lets see if they dare to take down 4chan too, now THAT would be big for ZeroNet.

1565338450_1Hbt9rJ8U9kpEFaxHAfLWzxWtKRYi.body:
>i only support free speech as long as its the speech that i like

Goodbye commie.

1565321266_1LT3fcyEShsU9E1H5wiBceWmEpU6L.body:
> [btfo](#comment_4_1CJskzeMQsk8eHw8m4ZaF6bMhwxbPCwhNX): You can always centralize a part of it. Just think about how something like confirmation of an online payment would work in zeronet.... it doesn't... the site for creating IDs can be centralized. Then it can do rate limiting or even captchas. [...]

>You can always centralize a part of it
NO, that defeats the whole purpose of ZeroNet, a chain is only as strong as its weakest link.
